title: List of famous people in alternative medicine
cleaned_text: List of famous people in alternative medicine [Jump to navigation](#mw-head) [Jump to search](#searchInput) Famous people in alternative medicine provides a master list of the biographical articles included in the [alternative medicine](/index.php/Terms_and_concepts_in_alternative_medicine#Alternative_medicine) ( [CAM](/index.php/Terms_and_concepts_in_alternative_medicine#CAM)) series of articles. A of the [Alexander Technique](/index.php/Alexander_Technique) B [Edward Bach](/index.php?title=Edward_Bach&action=edit&redlink=1)- founder of flower essence therapy and the Bach flower remedies. [Juliette de Bairacli Levy](/index.php/Juliette_de_Bairacli_Levy)- renowned for her skill in [William Bates](/index.php/William_Horatio_Bates)- founder eyesight improvement. [Paul Bragg](/index.php?title=Paul_Bragg&action=edit&redlink=1)- known for the Bragg Health Crusades, the Bragg Healthy Lifestyle, deep breathing, water fasts, organic foods, drinking water, juicing, exercise and listening to one's body. [Emanuel Bronner](/index.php?title=Emanuel_Bronner&action=edit&redlink=1)- aka "Dr. Bronner," master soap-maker known for eccentric messages on labels for natural soaps and other health products. C [Charaka](/index.php/Charaka)- is one of the founders of [Ayurveda](/index.php/Ayurveda). [Mantak Chia](/index.php?title=Mantak_Chia&action=edit&redlink=1)- claimed healer [sexuality](/index.php?title=Human_sexuality&action=edit&redlink=1)". [Hulda Regehr Clark](/index.php?title=Hulda_Regehr_Clark&action=edit&redlink=1)- wrote a series of books including The Cure for all Diseases, advocating extreme dietary practices and "zapping" of parasites. [Dr. Deepak Chopra](/index.php?title=Deepak_Chopra&action=edit&redlink=1)- Endocrinologist and Ayurvedic Medicine Practitioner, who writes popular books on health and spirituality. [Nicholas Culpeper](/index.php?title=Nicholas_Culpeper&action=edit&redlink=1)- an English physician of the early 17th century who left to future generations a rich store of pharmaceutical and herbal knowledge. D [Dr. Lorraine Day](/index.php?title=Lorraine_Day&action=edit&redlink=1)- major marketer of a 10 step alternative cure for cancer, and critic of [conventional medicine](/index.php/Conventional_medicine). E [Mary Baker Eddy](/index.php?title=Mary_Baker_Eddy&action=edit&redlink=1)- founder of [Christian Science](/index.php?title=Christian_Science&action=edit&redlink=1)and its readvocacy of Christian healing, thereby also reawakening 20th-century interest in the subject in more mainstream denominations as well as in certain more unrestrictive [New Age](/index.php?title=New_Age&action=edit&redlink=1)offshoots. [Donna Eden](/index.php/Donna_Eden)- known for developing energy medicine methods and sharing them with the public; author of Energy Medicine; founder of Eden Energy Certification Program F [Moshé Feldenkrais](/index.php?title=Mosh%C3%A9_Feldenkrais&action=edit&redlink=1)- founder of the [Feldenkrais [Sylvester Graham](/index.php?title=Sylvester_Graham&action=edit&redlink=1)- was known for his graham crackers and founded Grahamism. [Stanislav Grof](/index.php?title=Stanislav_Grof&action=edit&redlink=1)- one of the founders of the field of transpersonal psychology, a pioneering researcher into the use of altered states of consciousness for purposes of healing & growth, founder of Holotropic shamanic beliefs and practices from all over the world into a system now known as [neoshamanism](/index.php?title=Neoshamanism&action=edit&redlink=1). I J [Heinrich Jacoby](/index.php/Heinrich_Jacoby) [Bernard Jensen](/index.php?title=Bernard_Jensen&action=edit&redlink=1)- leading American [iridologist](/index.php/Iridology) K [John Harvey Kellogg](/index.php?title=John_Harvey_Kellogg&action=edit&redlink=1)- promoter of colon therapy at the Battle Creek Sanitarium in Battle Creek Michigan. [Will Keith Kellogg](/index.php?title=Will_Keith_Kellogg&action=edit&redlink=1)- inventor of corn flakes in 1894 and manager of the Battle Creek Sanitarium. [Sebastian Kneipp](/index.php?title=Sebastian_Kneipp&action=edit&redlink=1)- Bavarian priest who began the Nature Cure movement (1890s). Chiefly recognized for his contributions to [hydrotherapy](/index.php?title=Hydrotherapy&action=edit&redlink=1). L [Alexander Lowen](/index.php?title=Alexander_Lowen&action=edit&redlink=1) [Benedict Lust](/index.php?title=Benedict_Lust&action=edit&redlink=1)- Founder of [naturopathic medicine](/index.php/Naturopathic_medicine)in the United States. Purchased the rights to the term "naturopathy" from John Scheel. M [Caroline Myss](/index.php?title=Caroline_Myss&action=edit&redlink=1)- American [medical intuitive](/index.php?title=Medical_intuitive&action=edit&redlink=1), mystic and author of numerous books N [Devi Nambudripad](/index.php?title=Devi_Nambudripad&action=edit&redlink=1)- founder of NAET, controversial allergy treatment O Palmer](/index.php/Daniel_David_Palmer)- founder of [chiropractic](/index.php/Chiropractic). [B. J. Palmer](/index.php?title=B._J._Palmer&action=edit&redlink=1)- son of D.D. Palmer and known as the "developer" of [chiropractic](/index.php/Chiropractic). [Linus Pauling](/index.php/Linus_Pauling)- established a new discipline called [orthomolecular medicine](/index.php/Orthomolecular_medicine)and advocated the use of [Vitamin C](/index.php/Vitamin_C)to [viral respiratory diseases](/index.php/Common_cold#Vitamin_C), [mental illness](/index.php/Orthomolecular_psychiatry). Pauling was however not a general supporter of alternative medicine. [Vincent Priessnitz](/index.php?title=Vincent_Priessnitz&action=edit&redlink=1)- developed a system of water cures. Q R [Theron Randolph](/index.php?title=Theron_Randolph&action=edit&redlink=1)- father of modern allergy medicine, founder of environmental medicine [Wilhelm Reich](/index.php?title=Wilhelm_Reich&action=edit&redlink=1)- founder of Orgonomy. [Royal Rife](/index.php?title=Royal_Rife&action=edit&redlink=1) the Natural Hygiene movement. [Bernie Siegel](/index.php/Bernie_Siegel)- American MD and author who promotes cultivating one's attitude toward healing. [Rudolf Steiner](/index.php?title=Rudolf_Steiner&action=edit&redlink=1)- founded Hygieo-Therapy. U [Mikao Usui](/index.php?title=Mikao_Usui&action=edit&redlink=1)- founded [Reiki](/index.php/Reiki)during the early 20th century in Japan. V [Alberto Villoldo](/index.php?title=Alberto_Villoldo&action=edit&redlink=1), Ph.D. - psychologist and medical anthropologist, founder of The Four Winds Society and Healing the Light Body School W [Ita Wegman](/index.php?title=Ita_Wegman&action=edit&redlink=1) [Andrew Weil](/index.php?title=Andrew_Weil&action=edit&redlink=1)- founder of Integrative Medicine and author of many modern books on alternative medicine. [J. R. Worsley](/index.php?title=J._R._Worsley&action=edit&redlink=1)- founder of [Five Elements](/index.php?title=Five_Elements&action=edit&redlink=1)school of [acupuncture](/index.php/Acupuncture). in the American [Popular Health Movement](/index.php?title=Popular_Health_Movement&action=edit&redlink=1)of the 1830's and '40s. X Y [Yellow Emperor](/index.php?title=Yellow_Emperor&action=edit&redlink=1)(Huang Di) - [culture hero](/index.php?title=Culture_hero&action=edit&redlink=1)historically credited as the founder of traditional Chinese medicine. [Maharishi Mahesh Yogi](/index.php?title=Maharishi_Mahesh_Yogi&action=edit&redlink=1)- the founder
